text: Erigeron krylovii is an Asian species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows in grasslands and in alpine meadows in Siberia, Xinjiang, and Kazakhstan. Erigeron krylovii is a perennial, clump-forming herb up to 60 cm (5 feet) tall, forming woody rhizomes and a branching underground caudex. Its flower heads have pink, thread-like ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron krylovii Sergievskaya, 1945. 西疆飞蓬 xi jiang fei peng Sergievskaya, Lydia Palladievna 1945.
